body:
On what platforms is time.Now() not monotonic? For linux/amd64, time.Now is implemented by runtimeÂ·nanotime, which is calling clock_gettime (via VDSO) with CLOCK_MONOTONIC. I see similar calls being used on linux/arm, openbsd, freebsd, etc.

Instead of a new interface, can we document time.Now as monotonic?
